summary.para: Determines if one of the object's windows has the keyboard focus.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if one of the object's windows has the keyboard focus, or S_FALSE otherwise.

summary.para: Enables the object to process keyboard accelerators.

param.name: pMsg
param.para: The address of an structure that contains the keyboard message that is being translated.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if the accelerator was translated, or S_FALSE otherwise.

param.name: fActivate
param.para: Indicates if the object is being activated or deactivated. If this value is nonzero, the object is being activated. If this value is zero, the object is being deactivated.

param.name: pMsg
param.para: A pointer to an structure that contains the message that caused the activation change. This value may be NULL.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Exposes methods that change UI activation and process accelerators for a user input object contained in the Shell.

remarks.para: Implement IInputObject if you are implementing a Shell object that takes user input.
You do not call this interface directly. IInputObject is used by the Shell or the browser to notify the object of UI activation changes and to translate keyboard accelerators.
IInputObject is derived from . The listed methods are specific to IInputObject.
